titles.title: Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” / Mälkǝʾa sänbätä krǝstiyan “Image of the Sabbath of Christians”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dәrsanä sänbätä krǝstiyan “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jacob of Serug) (fols. 1r-33v, 38r-40v), incomplete and misplaced II) Mälkǝʾa sänbätä krǝstiyan “Image of the Sabbath of Christians”: 25 strophes (fols. 33v-37v, 41r-41v, 43r-44r).

txstates.txstate: The threads of the binding are broken. Some leaves are loose, some crudely attached to the binding by secondary, irregular stitches. Many leaves are damaged by rodents (esp. fols.: 1-8; 25-29; 38-44). Cut repaired on fol. 33. Some leaves are missing after fol. 29v; fols. 38r-40v have been misplaced: they should be before fol. 30r.

bindings.binding: Reddish-brown leather boards (two pieces of leather roughly sewn to each on the spine). One pair of sewing station.

squires.squire:
I(8/fols. 1r-8v) ― II(8/fols. 9r-16v) ― III(8/fols. 17r-24v) ― IV(5/fols. 25r-29v [fols. missing]) ― V(8/fols. 30r-37v) ― VI(7/fols. 38r-44v).
Fols. 38r-40v (Text I) have been misplaced; according to the text, they should be before fol. 30r.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible (fols. 20v-21r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand:
The handwriting is characterized by right-sloping and thick letters. The quality of the hand varies in Text II, where it appears less regular and uniform.
The words እግዚአብሔር፡ and እግዚእ፡ are usually written with ligature between ግ and ዚ (e.g., fols. 4r, 23r l.10).

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 1r: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ድርሳን፡ ዘደረሰ፡ አባ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘሥሩግ፡ በእንተ፤ ሰንበተ፤ ክርስቲያን፤ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብራ፡ [vac.] ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፨ ስምዑ፡ ፍቁራንየ፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፤…
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 1r: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. (This is) the homily which ʾabba Jaqob of Serug composed on the Sabbath of Christians. May her prayer and her blessing be with her servant… Forever and ever. Listen, my beloved ones, sons of the church…
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 33r, l.13: …ኦወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሕያው፡ ዕቀቦ፡ ለገብርከ፡ [vac.] ወ[fol. 33v]ተሣሃሎ፡ በብርሃነ፡ ጸጋከ፡ ከልሎ፡ ወበምግባረ፤ ጽድቅ፤ አብዕሎ፡ ወበዘይመጽእ፡ ዓለም፡  በክብረ፡ ነፍስ፡ አልዕሎ፡ ምስለ፡ ኅሩያኒከ፡ መክፈልተ፡ ክፍሎ፡ ለገብርከ፡ [vac.]
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 33r, l.13:  …O Son of the living God, protect your servant ... and have mercy upon him, with the light of your grace encircle him, and with the deeds of the righteousness enrich him. And in the world which will come, elevate him with the glory of the spirit, grant him a portion with your elects,  to your servant ...

desccontent.incipit: Fol. 33v, l.6: ሰላም፡ [ለ]አዝከረ፡ ስምኪ፡ ስመ፡ ነከራ፡ ወተዓፅቦ፨ ወለርእስኪ፡ ሰላም፡ ብርሃነ፡ መለኮት፡ ዘይገለብቦ። ሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቅድስት፡ ዕረፍተ፡ ኀጥአን፡ እምተመንድቦ፨ ዕቀበኒ፡ ለመልአከ፡ ኀጕል፡ ከመ፡ ኢይኩን፡ መርከቦ፨
desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 33v, l.6: Salutation to the reminding of your name, the name of wonder and astonishment. And salutation to your head, which the light of the divinity covers. St. Sabbath of Christians, repose of the sinners from the torments. Protect me so that I would not become a ship of the angel of perdition!
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 44r, l. 7: …ሰን፡ ክ፡ ቅ፡ ሀብኒ፡ ፍትሐ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ለላዕለቴ[sic]: በከመ፡    <…> ይነሥእ፡ ዓሰ ባ[sic]፡ ፃማሁ፡ ዝ ንተ፡ <…> አሳባ፡ ድርሳንየ፡ ኢይጥፋዕ፡ በከንቱ።
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 44r, l. 7: … St. Sabbath of Christians, give me the justice of your high compassion; as <…>  he takes a reward of his toils, this <…>  the reward of my writing may not perish in vain. (?)
desccontent.details: The text, between fols. 37v and 44r, is interrupted by Text II: fols. 38r-40v (Text I) have been misplaced and rebound between them (quire VI).

extras.extra: - Space for rubricated names left unfilled in supplication formulas: e.g., fols. 1r, 5r, 26v, 32v, 33r, 33v. - Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally: fols. 4v, 5r, 37r, 39r. - Writing exercises (?) in the bottom margins of fols. 2r, 25v, 26r. - Crude notes in pencil on fols. 42r, 43v (below the text) and 44v.
